intro: Teijsmanniodendron novoguineense, commonly known as the New Guinea teijsmanniodendron, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the rainforests of New Guinea and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
